subtitle: This recipe is ideal for the small gooseberries that appear at the start of the summer season. The crisp textured shortcake mixture is excellent with most fruits.

method.text: Preheat oven to 190°C. Lightly grease and flour two 20 cm sandwich tins.
Heat the sugar and water in a pan. Add the gooseberries and simmer for 5-8 min until soft. Leave to cool.
Cream the butter or margarine with the sugar and ground ginger until soft and light. Add the flour, mix well. Blend in the egg and enough milk to make a soft rolling consistency.
Divide the dough into two equal-sized portions. Roll or press out to fit inside the sandwich tins.
Bake for 20-25 min until golden and firm. Turn out onto a wire cooling tray.
Drain the fruit. Sandwich the shortcake layers with half the gooseberries. Top with the remaining gooseberries and a very thick dusting of icing sugar. Serve hot or cold.

title: Gooseberry shortcake
